intro: Epilobium × friburgense, commonly known as the Friburg velvetleaf, is a hybrid species within the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive velvety appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with four petals and numerous stamens, contributing to its ornamental value. Epilobium × friburgense is often found in temperate regions of Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world.
